column4: I have no experience with 64bit linux, but it might be advantagous to install 32bit ubuntu in a virtualbox, and do the 32bit compiling there. ubottu has some links for virtualbox, do /msg ubottu virtualbox
thanks, but i'd really like to do it without virtualization (i have a 32bit pc if no other way)
ok, how about installing 32bit ubuntu on a seperate partition, but don't boot into it, just mount it in 64bit ubuntu and chroot into the 32bit?
would be possible but still it's much of a too big step for me, I think I'll just add this source on my 32bit ubuntu desktop :), thanks though :)
